poem.title: A 1988 Volkswagen Golf
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Amalgam grey car
Dunted and dented
As space station Mir
Limoes steered clear of you
Last of the kind
A good plumber could fix
What passengers out of touch
Beyond protection
One glum, careful owner
Has sold you for scrap
Gum in the socket
Swing low
